DOC.brief_summary: - Prospective, randomized, controlled, multi-center study - A total of 390 subjects with critical limb ischemia will be included according to inclusion and exclusion criteria. - Patients will be randomized in a 1:1:1 manner into triple antiplatelet therapy (TAP: aspirin, clopidogrel, cilostazol) group, dual antiplatelet therapy (DAP: aspirin, clopidogrel) A group, or DAP (aspirin, cilostazol) B group. - All patients will be treated with angioplasty for critical limb ischemia. - Patients will be followed clinically for 1 year after the procedure. - Ankle-brachial index and Image study follow-up (Duplex US or CT angiography) will be performed at 1 year.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Cilostazol-based Triple Antiplatelet Therapy Versus Dual Antiplatelet Therapy for Outcomes of below-the Knee Endovascular Intervention in Patients With Critical Limb Ischemia (TAP CLI Study)
